## Description {#details}

Writes MessagePack objects to an output stream, one at a time.

Definition at line 41 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### Writer() {#a4c1d1c6bc2417d1b113c6cdf523348fa}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Writer::Writer (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS, bool Compatible=false)</>}>
Construct a writer, optionally enabling &quot;Compatibility Mode&quot; as defined in the MessagePack specification.

When in <code>Compatible</code> mode, the writer will write <code>Str16</code> formats instead of <code>Str8</code> formats, and will refuse to write any <code>Bin</code> formats.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="OS">stream to output MessagePack objects to.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Compatible">when set, write in &quot;Compatibility Mode&quot;.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00051">51</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00022">22</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### write() {#ae442502a977e2cd0cae79630b03ec1d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Writer::write (int64&#95;t i)</>}>
Write a signed integer to the output stream.

The output will be in the smallest possible <em>int</em> format.

The format chosen may be for an unsigned integer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00071">71</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00029">29</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.

### write() {#aef4ecef7a05cd113a04ae7504c4ff08b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Writer::write (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferref">MemoryBufferRef</a> Buffer)</>}>
Write a memory buffer to the output stream.

The output will be in the smallest possible <em>bin</em> format.


:::warning
Do not use this overload if in <code>Compatible</code> mode.
:::

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00093">93</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00123">123</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeArraySize() {#a8ed0ae40a1f440ec59f5e7d22b99a65c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Writer::writeArraySize (uint32&#95;t Size)</>}>
Write the header for an <em>Array</em> of the given size.

The output will be in the smallest possible <em>array</em> format. The header contains an identifier for the <em>array</em> format used, as well as an encoding of the size of the array.

N.B. The caller must subsequently call <code>Write</code> an additional <code>Size</code> times to complete the array.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeExt() {#ac51fde5dfbfcac23216ca22b76b26bf5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Writer::writeExt (int8&#95;t Type, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferref">MemoryBufferRef</a> Buffer)</>}>
Write a typed memory buffer (an extension type) to the output stream.

The output will be in the smallest possible <em>ext</em> format.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00121">121</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00175">175</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeMapSize() {#a50372c2c26c41e47324691f53269072a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Writer::writeMapSize (uint32&#95;t Size)</>}>
Write the header for a <em>Map</em> of the given size.

The output will be in the smallest possible <em>map</em> format. The header contains an identifier for the <em>map</em> format used, as well as an encoding of the size of the map.

N.B. The caller must subsequently call <code>Write</code> and additional <code>Size&#42;2</code> times to complete the map. Each even numbered call to <code>Write</code> defines a new key, and each odd numbered call defines the previous key&#39;s value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h/#l00116">116</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-h">MsgPackWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp/#l00159">159</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/binaryformat/msgpackwriter-cpp">MsgPackWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeNil() {#a0282d6201e15dba0d5fda1a4774e45df}

<MemberDefinition

Write a <em>Nil</em> to the output stream.

The output will be the <em>nil</em> format.
